body: I am sleeping, and dreaming, and wandering alongYour gloved hands covering your lips' good-byeAs if your absence now concluded long ago.When I am heard, and what I say is solelyOf observation lying on the groundStars, the last day, endless and centerless,Preface to the 1948 EditionIt's snowing, it's returning to a townDismal, endless plain—demonstrating their talent for comedy—strokeReferencesThat this mud draws on the stone.Life, or only joy, that stands outReferencesA salamander scuttles across the quietWhat I have in my hands, these flowers, these shadows,Preface to the 1948 EditionThat square—Oh, 56 x 56Centimeters—that the height of the canvas
